channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-3525] mvn assembly is over-filling the hbase lib dir
item.description:
Here is what our lib dir looks this in 0.90.1:


-rwxr-xr-x  1 Stack  staff    62983 Mar 16  2009 activation-1.1.jar

-rwxr-xr-x  1 Stack  staff  1034049 May 21  2009 ant-1.6.5.jar

We are picking up bunch of hadoop dependencies. I'd think it harmless other than the bulk.
item.summary: mvn assembly is over-filling the hbase lib dir

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This seems to work. I can run all out of an assembly and then in the assembly I can build a new assembly; i.e. we retain fact that we can build out of tarball. Just added flag and explicit exclusion of the hbase jar to assembly and then it seems like we needed commons-el... least w/o it, UI won't draw (we were getting it via hadoop transclusion up to this).
Marking patch available. Any chance of a review? I think its needed before we can cut an RC1.

I don't really understand what the problem is here.
We're obviously picking up transitive dependencies. To exclude all of them sounds...dangerous? I mean they could be needed.
I hear you Lars. I tested though, building and running. They don't seem necessary. Most are transitively included because of hadoop dependency. With this patch in place, the jars go from ~60 to ~30.
Committed branch and trunk (LarsF, if this breaks stuff, pass me your skype id so I can put up session for you to do "I told you so").
Lars and Stack, you better exchange skype IDs. See HBASE-3594
@Lars I'm michaelstack on Skype. Let me know when its convenient for you. I'll need to go get my sackcloth outfit first so give me a bit of a headsup.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #1767 (See https://hudson.apache.org/hudson/job/HBase-TRUNK/1767/)
Revert HBASE-3525 due to HBASE-3594 - rest server failing because of missing asm jar

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
